intro: Rorippa neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia watercress, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and rocky crevices. Its leaves are succulent and often have a peppery flavor, similar to other members of its family. Rorippa neocaledonica is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
